title: 0 Days since my last game against a smurf.
body:
Same %%%% as always.

Tell my team calmly "guys this trist is a gold smurf dont fight him he will fuck your shit up"

My teams response is to come "gank" mid and all die to the trist.

lets just say by the end of the game i had called atleast every member of my team a fucking retard for attempting to fight the trist and feeding her nearly 20 kills.

The really sad part is, if they had just stopped being bronze for 2 seconds, and listened to their fucking mastery 7 fucking akali midlaner who can carry any fucking bronze team in the game if they fucking listen to her.

we mightve won.

But no, bronzies gonna bronze.

replies.body:
Whether you said it before or after, people tend to be pretty resistant to advice from someone who calls them a "fucking retard" whether it's valid advice or not.

There really aren't all that many smurfs in Bronze, as most of them wouldn't drop there since you start Silver 3~. Not to say there aren't any, there are those that drop to test themselves (report them), whose who drop to troll there (again, report them, they'll get banned hella fast) and those that are smurfs of Bronze players trying to reset their mmr/get a better idea of where they should be (at which point the smurfiness is irrelevant).

Skill in Bronze is inconsistent, so scores tend to be pretty polarising and games tend to be pretty one sided one way or the other. This is a part of being in Bronze, not because it's filled with smurfs.

Just because someone is doing really well, doesn't mean they're a smurf, even if they say they are, more than likely they're taking every opportunity they can to boost their ego. If you **know** for whatever that they're a smurf then **report them for it**. If they purposefully dropped into Bronze to troll/stomp then that is no bueno and you should 100% report them (and explain why in the comment).

Past that I'd recommend considering how you are giving advice. Look at what you're saying as if it was a complete stranger (you have no idea of their skill/consistency/strengths/weaknesses etc, and you have a different perspective/understanding of the game) and see if you'd think it was valid advice or if you'd be offended that they think they can tell you what to do. 

You want to suggest, not demand, or all you're doing is convincing them you aren't worth listening to. You have to leave the door open, not open it, yell something at the person on the other side then slam it in their face.

I don't play much ranked, but I haven't encountered a smurf this whole season yet xD.

I think your really unlucky bro, but something I can relate to is bronze players being totally ignorant like their opinion or way about things is better than there teams.

True, like i have no problem with that attitude if they are clearly better than their team, im no hypocrit.

But its the ones who are clearly failing at whatever they are trying to do and refuse to listen to reason that get me.

Like as an example take a few days ago i had a riven top that fed the crap out of a trynd.

Fair enough normal business in bronze the feeding isnt what pissed me off.

The part that pissed me off is i told her after her second death to take it easy and stop pushing so hard into her lane she was clearly outmatched by this trynd and cannot fight him 1v1, the proper action wouldve been to ease up farm up and roam for a pick or two then take that gold and roll it into a defensive item (so in rivens case lots of ad for her shield) then once she was strong enough to fight trynd then go back to 1v1ing him.

Instead she took her already behind ass and kept engaging until she was 2/10 and claimed my advice was wrong because "if you knew that shit you wouldnt be bronze"
how many more of these will there be?
You just admitted to a smurf carrying their team in Bronze. So you've just contradicted 99% of your posts
whats more annoying is when someone claims to be a smurf then feeds hard.

I've actually met more people being boosted and smurfing around plat 1/diamond 5 than any other elo. 

It can be annoying, but i'm used to it. (And every plat/diamond player i know has a smurf too)

I guess the elo that it hurts the most is bronze, as there wouldn't be a reason needed to have a smurf?
LOL, made my day, relateable but you can't stop someone from bullying a lower elo unfortunately

Yeah it is a pretty good story isnt it.

id tell it every time it happens but id get reported for spamming since theres a bloody smurf or premade of smurfs every 10 games or so.
